items.title: Nintendo goes in-depth on Switch 2 backward compatibility
items.author: Chris Welch
items.summary:
- Nintendo's Switch 2 will support many original Switch titles at launch on June 5th.
- A detailed resource page outlines tested titles, indicating most last-gen games will run smoothly.
- Titles like Ring Fit Adventure and 1-2-Switch are supported with original Joy-Cons or workarounds.
- Currently, only the VR Labo kit is confirmed to be incompatible.
- Some games have startup issues, while others have in-game compatibility issues; improvements are ongoing.
- Nintendo plans to provide upgrades for original Switch titles through future patches, including games like Arms and Super Mario Odyssey.

items.title: FromSoftware is making a multiplayer Switch 2 exclusive called The Duskbloods
items.author: Antonio G. Di Benedetto
items.summary:
- New game titled *The Duskbloods* to be launched exclusively on Nintendo Switch 2 in 2026.
- Teaser trailer revealed during Nintendo's Switch 2 Direct presentation; directed by Hidetaka Miyazaki.
- Features PvPvE multiplayer gameplay, differing from traditional single-player focus of FromSoftware's previous titles.
- Comparisons made to *Bloodborne* due to gothic aesthetics and potential thematic elements.
- More details expected in a Creator's Voice article with Miyazaki on April 4th, 2026.

items.title: Kirby Air Riders is a Switch 2 racing game from Masahiro Sakurai
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- Masahiro Sakurai returns to lead the development of a sequel to the GameCube racing game *Kirby Air Ride*.
- *Kirby Air Ride* originally launched in 2003 as a four-player racing game featuring Kirby and unlockable characters like Meta Knight and King Dedede.
- The new game, titled *Kirby Air Riders*, is set to be released on the Switch 2 in 2025, likely after the console's launch on June 5th.

items.title: Donkey Kong Bananza is coming to the Switch 2 in July
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Nintendo is launching a new 3D game, Donkey Kong Bananza, exclusively for the Nintendo Switch 2.
- The game's release date is set for July 17th, following the Switch 2's launch on June 5th.
- Donkey Kong Bananza is a 3D platformer featuring a new style inspired by his appearance in The Super Mario Bros. Movie.
- Players will navigate an underground world, utilizing skills like climbing, bashing, and throwing to progress through the game.
- The game includes both 3D and 2D gameplay elements, with energizing visuals and expressive characters.

items.title: Mario Kart World launches exclusively with the Nintendo Switch 2
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary:
- Nintendo has announced a new game titled *Mario Kart World* for the Switch 2, launching on June 5th.
- The game will retail for $79.99 and will be included in a $499.99 launch bundle for the console.
- Features include an open-world mode called “Free Roam,” atmospheric effects based on time and weather, and races with up to 24 drivers.
- New gameplay mechanics like grinding on rails, wall jumping, and character customization were showcased.
- The reveal was part of a Nintendo Direct event that provided more details on the Switch 2 and its game lineup.

items.title: Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment hits the Switch 2 this winter
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- Nintendo announced the new game *Age of Imprisonment* during the Switch 2 Direct.
- This installment is a prequel focusing on Princess Zelda and King Rauru's battle against Ganondorf.
- The game is set to release this winter and features gameplay with Zelda and Rauru fighting Hylian monsters.
- The *Zelda* franchise has been crucial to the Switch's success, with previous titles like *Breath of the Wild* being critically acclaimed.
- The franchise is also expanding into live-action adaptations and theme park experiences.

items.title: Netflix Expands Subtitles and Dubbing Options for TV Viewing
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Netflix now offers a full list of language options for subtitles and dubbing when watching on TV.
- This change allows users to choose from many languages instead of the previous 5-7 based on location.
- The new feature provides flexibility similar to mobile and web browsing options, which was highly anticipated for TV viewing.

items.title: Hollow Knight: Silksong is launching in 2025
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Hollow Knight: Silksong has a new release window set for 2025.
- Originally announced as DLC for Hollow Knight, it grew too large and unique for that purpose.
- The game will feature a new kingdom, moves, weapons, and enemies.
- Gameplay was previously showcased during E3 2019, with only a few updates since.
- It was delayed shortly before its expected release in 2022.

items.title: GameCube games are coming to Nintendo Switch Online
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
- GameCube games will be added to Nintendo Switch Online on June 5th, coinciding with the Switch 2 launch.
- Titles include *The Legend of Zelda: The Wind Waker*, *Soul Calibur 2*, *F-Zero GX*, and more.
- Enhanced image quality and higher resolution are promised for the new releases.
- Additional games mentioned include *Super Mario Sunshine*, *Fire Emblem: Path of Radiance*, *Pokémon XD: Gale of Darkness*, and others.
- The GameCube library will be part of the Nintendo Switch Online: Expansion Pack subscription.

items.title: The Switch 2’s Pro Controller adds customizable rear buttons
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- Nintendo unveils a new Pro Controller for the upcoming [Switch 2](https://www.theverge.com/news/630264/nintendo-switch-2-specs-details-performance).  
- Features new rear buttons ('GL' and 'GR') for customizable controls and a 'C' button for voice/video chats.  
- Includes a 3.5mm audio jack at the bottom.  
- Controller maintains a similar layout to the original but switches to a matte black body with glossy white accents.  
- No price announced, but the original Switch Pro Controller retails at $69.99. Likely to launch on June 5th alongside the Switch 2.

items.title: Nintendo is upgrading the Switch’s best Zelda games with Switch 2 Editions
items.author: Chris Welch
items.summary: - Nintendo announced enhanced versions of The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild and The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom for the Switch 2. - The games will feature improved resolution, frame rates, and HDR support, aiming for smooth 60fps gameplay. - A new second-screen experience called Zelda’s Notes will assist players via the Nintendo Switch app, providing locations on the map and guidance for discovering in-game features. - The Nintendo Switch Online app will be renamed to simply "Nintendo Switch" by the end of May.

items.title: The Nintendo Switch 2 has a camera accessory for video chats
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Nintendo announces the Nintendo Switch 2 Camera, allowing video chats with friends.
- The camera is designed to sit next to the TV and can be used with Nintendo's new GameChat system.
- Users can display their face via an overlay on games or as a standalone video feed.
- Some games, including upgraded Mario Party: Jamboree, will utilize the camera for minigames and to show friends' faces while playing.
- The camera launches on June 5th, coinciding with the release date of the Switch 2.

items.title: Metroid Prime 4: Beyond is getting a Nintendo Switch 2 Edition
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Nintendo announced a Nintendo Switch 2 Edition for *Metroid Prime 4: Beyond* with new control options and enhanced graphics modes.
- Players can use the Joy-Con’s mouse functionality and choose between quality (4K 60fps docked, 1080p 60fps handheld) and performance modes (1080p 120fps docked, 720p 120fps handheld) with HDR.
- The game is set to release in 2025, following a recent Nintendo Direct demonstration showcasing the planet Viewros and new abilities of Samus Aran.

items.title: Nintendo’s Switch 2 ‘C’ button is a Discord-like GameChat feature
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
- Nintendo reveals the purpose of the new ‘C’ button on the Switch 2 controller as a GameChat feature.
- GameChat allows players to communicate via the console's built-in microphone and features background noise filtering.
- The feature also supports screen sharing, enabling friends to broadcast their gameplay during group calls, regardless of the game being played.

items.title: Segway’s robot mower for massive lawns hits the US
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Segway’s Navimow X3 series now available in the US; includes models for large lawns.
- Models range from $2,299 X315 (0.4 acres) to $4,999 X390 (2.5 acres).
- Mows 1.25 acres in 24 hours; covers 0.3 acres per charge; 80 minutes to recharge.
- Equipped with add-on support for trimmer, fertilizer spreader, launching in Summer 2025.
- Uses Exact Fusion Location System for navigation; identifies over 200 obstacles.
- Operates at 60 dB; includes anti-theft GPS tracking.
- Can be managed via app or voice controls with Alexa and Google Home.
- X390 priced lower than Husqvarna’s $5,900 equivalent; competition for smaller lawns with new models coming soon.

items.title: Tesla’s sales plummet 13 percent as Musk backlash grows
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- Tesla's sales fell 13% year over year in Q1 2025, producing 362,615 vehicles and delivering 336,681.
- Deliveries included 323,800 Model 3 and Model Y vehicles, marking a 12.9% decline from Q1 2024.
- The report was Tesla's worst in three years, with stock dropping nearly 36% in 2025.
- Sales in Europe down nearly 43% year over year; China saw a decline until the last week of the quarter.
- Other automakers report strong EV sales; General Motors sold nearly 32,000 EVs in Q1, doubling year over year.
- Musk's political controversies and protests against the company are impacting sales, with a movement aimed at boycotting Tesla.
- Musk plans to launch an “unsupervised” robotaxi pilot in June in Austin, Texas, amid skepticism about autonomous driving technology.

items.title: Adobe launches Premiere Pro’s generative AI video extender
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Adobe Premiere Pro version 25.2 is launched with AI-powered features for improved video editing.
- Introduces Generative Extend, allowing two seconds of clip extension and ambient audio extension.
- Generative Extend is free for a limited time; later requires Firefly credits based on video format and resolution.
- New AI-powered Search panel to recognize and search video content using descriptive text.
- Premiere Color Management tool introduced for better editing experience with log and raw files.
- Automatic translation of video captions into 27 languages with multiple track display capability during editing.
- Enhanced performance for both Apple silicon and Windows devices.
- Accompanied by After Effects 25.2 with new HDR features and improved caching for previewing longer compositions.

items.title: Everything revealed during the Nintendo Switch 2 Direct
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
- Nintendo to reveal more on the Switch 2 during a Direct on April 2nd at 9 AM ET.
- The console will have backward compatibility and allow digital game transfers via a new virtual game card system.
- Speculations about a new “C” button on Joy-Con controllers and mouse functionality.
- New games such as a Mario Kart title confirmed; expected cross-gen releases include Metroid Prime 4 and Pokémon Legends: Z-A.
- Direct to provide detailed insights into the console and its features.

items.title: Samsung’s Tab S10 FE tablets arrive with a $50 price hike
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- Samsung launches the Tab S10 FE and Tab S10 FE Plus with a $50 price increase over predecessors.
- The Tab S10 FE has a 10.9-inch screen, while the FE Plus has a new 13.1-inch display.
- Both tablets feature LCD panels, 90Hz refresh rates, and run on Android 15.
- They are powered by the Exynos 1580 chipset, with options for up to 12GB RAM and 256GB storage.
- Available from April 10th; the Tab S10 FE starts at $499.99 and the FE Plus at $649.99, with a 5G version for an additional $100.

items.title: Micro USB is the bane of my existence
items.author: Victoria Song
items.summary:
* The author expresses frustration with the continued use of Micro USB ports in gadgets after USB-C became mainstream.
* USB-C was introduced in 2014, yet many devices still rely on Micro USB, including recent tech products.
* The European Union has mandated that all new devices sold in the EU must support USB-C charging to reduce e-waste.
* The regulation applies to various devices but still allows for proprietary chargers, complicating the transition away from Micro USB.
* Adoption of USB-C is improving and is expected to continue, but consumers still face challenges with existing Micro USB products.

items.title: Valve fixes Steam Deck update that caused boot loops
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- Valve issued a corrective update for the Steam client on Steam Decks after previous update caused boot loops.
- The problematic update was released on April 1st, following a SteamOS update on March 31st.
- Users reported issues with boot loops and missing GPU clock speed settings through Reddit and GitHub.
- Valve re-released the client update to fix these issues and also released updates to the beta channel for the same problems.

items.title: Roblox will let parents block people on their child’s friends list
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Roblox introduces new parental controls to allow parents to block users on their child's friends list.
- Parents can now block their children from accessing specific games and experiences.
- Children under 13 cannot unblock users or experiences that have been blocked by parents, but can request unblocking.
- Parents can view the 20 experiences their children have spent the most time in during the past week.
- These updates follow previous changes aimed at enhancing child safety on the platform.

items.title: Motorola’s first Edge 60 phone feels like canvas
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- Motorola announces the Edge 60 Fusion, priced at £299.99 (around $390).
- The phone features a unique faux-canvas finish, available only in the teal version, with other colors in faux leather.
- It has IP68 and 69 ratings for dust and water resistance.
- The device is slim, under 8mm thick, with a 5,200mAh battery and a 6.67-inch OLED screen.
- RAM options up to 12GB and storage up to 512GB are available, using a MediaTek Dimensity chipset (7300 or 7400).
- Camera setup includes a 50MP main lens and a 13MP ultrawide, but limited to four sensors accounting for flash and flicker sensor.
- Expected to be first of the Edge 60 series, with previous models not launched in the US.

items.title: Here are the best Apple Watch deals right now
items.author: Brandon Widder
items.summary:
- Apple launched the Apple Watch Series 10 and Ultra 2 in September 2023.
- The Apple Watch Series 10 is on sale starting at $329, down $70 from MSRP.
- The Apple Watch Series 9 is available starting at $280, offering marginal upgrades.
- The second-gen Apple Watch SE starts at $199 and includes features from the Series 8.
- The rugged Apple Watch Ultra 2 is priced starting at $735, with improved display and battery life.
- Deals are currently available on Amazon and Walmart for various models.

items.title: Visible’s new plan puts Verizon’s to shame
items.author: Allison Johnson
items.summary:
- Visible has launched a new premium plan called the Visible Plus Pro for $45 per month.
- The plan offers unlimited 5G Ultrawideband (UW) data, contrasting with Verizon's Unlimited Welcome plan that costs $65 and lacks 5G UW.
- Visible’s Plus Pro plan includes unlimited hotspot usage at 15 Mbps, 4K video streaming, and service for one smartwatch, features not available with Verizon's basic plan.
- The plan is not subject to data prioritization limitations, which is beneficial compared to typical budget carriers.
- A comparison suggests that Visible Plus Pro may have a higher priority on the network than Verizon's own plans, improving performance during congestion.

items.title: Trump advisor reportedly used personal Gmail for ‘sensitive’ military discussions
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- National Security Advisor Michael Waltz reportedly used personal Gmail for discussing sensitive military positions and powerful weapons systems.
- Emails indicated that while Waltz used Gmail, other officials used their government-issued accounts for similar communications.
- National Security Council spokesman Brian Hughes stated that Waltz did not and would not send classified information through an open account.
- The incident gained attention after Waltz invited a journalist to a Signal chat regarding a military strike in Yemen.
- Attorney General Pam Bondi mentioned the incident is unlikely to be criminally investigated, referencing past personal email scandals.

items.title: Here’s more of what you’ll see through Meta’s $1,000 smart glasses
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Meta is preparing a higher-end version of Ray-Ban smart glasses, codenamed Hypernova, launching by the end of the year.
- Hypernova features a built-in screen for running apps and displaying photos, with controls using hand gestures and capacitive touch.
- The glasses will have an improved camera and could cost between $1,000 and $1,400, while the current model starts at $299.
- Hypernova will include a neural wristband controller and a future version, Hypernova 2, is planned for 2027 with two screens.

items.title: Google is fixing outdated Pixel weather forecasts
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Google Pixel users reported outdated forecasts in the At a Glance widget.
- Users noted discrepancies between the current temperature and expected high/low forecasts.
- Google is addressing the issue with a fix currently being rolled out as stated by spokesperson Matthew Flegal.
- The problem involves displaying yesterday's forecast as today or future predictions incorrectly.

items.title: The best deals left over from Amazon’s Big Spring Sale
items.author: Cameron Faulkner
items.summary:
- Amazon's Big Spring Sale featured products with significant discounts still available as of April 1, 2025.
- Deals include discounts on headphones, robot vacuums, chargers, and OLED TVs.
- Some offers are available to non-Prime members, maximizing shopping access.
- Competing deals are highlighted at retailers like Best Buy and Walmart.
- Featured products include:
  - **Hoto Electric Screwdriver** for $50.
  - **LG B4 OLED TV** for $550.
  - **Baseus USB-C Cable** for $10.
  - **Google Pixel Buds Pro 2** for $179.
  - **Dreame X40 Robot Vacuum** for $1,000.

items.title: Roblox players are going to start getting paid to watch ads
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Roblox is launching "Rewarded Video ads" that pay players with in-game currency and power-ups for watching ads.
- These full-screen video ads can be up to 30 seconds long and will be available for purchase via Google’s advertising solutions.
- Only public experiences owned by users over 18 will be eligible to show ads, and they will target players aged 13 and older.
- The ads are part of an expansion of Google’s "Immersive Ads" format, designed to integrate naturally into the game environment.

items.title: T-Mobile closes Lumos deal after dropping DEI
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- T-Mobile has closed its joint venture deal with Lumos, having removed its DEI webpage.
- The DEI page was online until at least March 26 and outlined T-Mobile's culture of inclusion.
- The removal appears to be a response to FCC Chair Brendan Carr's threats regarding DEI policies affecting mergers.
- T-Mobile's executive vice president stated the company is reviewing its DEI policies to comply with FCC regulations.
- The FCC approved the Lumos deal on March 28 after T-Mobile promised not to promote discrimination.
- Carr has also investigated DEI practices at other companies like Comcast, Verizon, and Disney, leading to scrutiny from Democrats in the Energy and Commerce Committee.

items.title: The best phone to buy right now
items.author: Allison Johnson
items.summary:
- Most users prefer familiar phones that work reliably.
- Iterative improvements dominate the current phone market; new devices focus on software more than hardware.
- Notable options include the iPhone 16, Google Pixel 9, and Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra.
- iPhone 16 features A18 chipset, Action Button, and advanced camera system, priced at $799.
- Google Pixel 9 offers great design and reliable camera capabilities at $649 but lacks a telephoto lens.
- The Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra is touted as the best high-end Android, with top specs and features, priced at $1,100.
- Many budget options available under $600, with specific recommendations for excellent budget smartphones.

items.title: Thousands of federal health workers are losing their jobs in the US
items.author: Justine Calma
items.summary:
- The Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) is undergoing significant workforce reductions, impacting agencies like the CDC and FDA.
- Thousands of CDC employees were notified of layoffs, reassessments, or remote assignments as part of a 20,000-person workforce reduction initiated by the Trump administration.
- Critics warn that these cuts may lead to preventable deaths due to compromised public health programs, while HHS claims the changes will save $1.8 billion annually.
- FDA officials, including Peter Marks, have resigned, citing a lack of commitment to truth and transparency under the new administration.

items.title: All of the updates about OpenAI
items.author: Kylie Robison
items.summary:
- OpenAI raised $40 billion led by SoftBank, reaching a $300 billion valuation.
- ChatGPT is generating Studio Ghibli-style art, leading to a mix of reactions online.
- OpenAI's leadership change includes COO Brad Lightcap overseeing operations as Sam Altman focuses on technical direction.
- OpenAI is facing delays for free-tier users in accessing the new image generation feature due to high demand and operational challenges.
- Privacy concerns arise from a case where a Norwegian man was falsely labeled by ChatGPT as a murderer.

items.title: Must-Have Accessories for Xbox Series X/S
items.author: Cameron Faulkner
items.summary:
- Xbox Series X and S can be enhanced with various accessories.
- Recommended controllers: 
  - [Xbox Wireless Controller](https://www.amazon.com/Xbox-Wireless-Gaming-Headset-Headphones-Console/dp/B0DH689JGY?tag=theverge02-20): Features share button, Bluetooth support, and USB-C port.
  - [Xbox Elite Series 2 Controller](https://www.amazon.com/Elite-2-Controller-Black-Xbox-One/dp/B07SFKTLZM/?tag=theverge02-20): Offers more customization but at a higher price.
- Storage options include [Seagate](https://www.amazon.com/Seagate-Storage-Expansion-Solid-State/dp/B08K3S6WJM?th=1&tag=theverge02-20) and [Western Digital expansion cards](https://www.amazon.com/WD_Black-Storage-Expansion-Card-WDBMPH0010BNC-WCSN/dp/B0C44XVWCH/?tag=theverge02-20).
- Other accessories featured: PowerA Enhanced Wired Controller, Xbox Wireless Headset, charging stands, and more.

items.title: Keanu Reeves is coming back for John Wick 5
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- Lionsgate announced the greenlighting of John Wick 5 during CinemaCon.
- Keanu Reeves will reprise his role as John Wick, also known as Baba Yaga.
- No plot details have been released yet, but director Chad Stahelski and producers Basil Iwanyk and Erica Lee are attached.
- An animated prequel featuring Reeves is also in development, focusing on his past tasks.
- Donnie Yen is set to star in and direct a live-action spinoff centered around his character from John Wick: Chapter 4.

items.title: NFL swaps first-down chains for Sony's 8K cameras
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Starting with the current football season, the NFL will utilize Sony’s Hawk-Eye cameras for measuring first downs.
- The system consists of six 8K cameras utilizing optical tracking, creating a digital measurement to display in stadiums and on TV.
- It is estimated that using this technology will reduce the measurement time to around 30 seconds, significantly faster than the traditional chain crew process.
- The chain crew will remain on the field in a secondary role despite the new technology.
- Sony's Hawk-Eye technology was tested last year and will be implemented in all 30 US NFL stadiums as well as international venues.

items.title: Hyundai’s Insteroid is an EV one-off for gamers
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Hyundai unveils the "Insteroid" concept EV in Seoul, inspired by gaming and street racing.
- The vehicle features a wide body kit, massive spoiler, track wheels, and a stripped interior.
- The Insteroid will also appear in a web-based video game developed by Hyundai.
- The aim is to boost interest in the production model, the Inster, launching in Korea this summer with prices starting under $26,000.

items.title: Runway says its latest AI video model can actually generate consistent scenes and people
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- AI startup Runway introduced its Gen-4 video model for consistent scene generation.
- The model allows for character and object continuity across shots using a single reference image.
- Gen-4 is currently rolling out to paid and enterprise users, enhancing storytelling control.
- A demonstration video showed a woman maintaining her appearance across varying contexts.
- This release follows the Gen-3 Alpha model, which had issues related to training data from YouTube.

items.title: Hundreds of scientists accuse Donald Trump of censorship
items.author: Justine Calma
items.summary:
- More than 1,900 scientists and engineers have warned of dangers from the Trump administration’s cuts to scientific research funding.
- A letter states that the administration is destabilizing the research enterprise by cutting funding, firing scientists, and pressuring researchers on ideological grounds.
- The letter's signatories accuse the administration of censorship affecting climate change and vaccine initiatives, highlighting significant impacts on universities and the research community.

items.title: ZeniMax union votes to authorize a strike
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
- ZeniMax Workers United, a union of over 300 quality assurance workers, voted with over 94% in favor to authorize a strike.
- The authorization allows the union to call a strike if contract negotiations with Microsoft break down, which have been ongoing for two years.
- Issues raised include employee concerns over wages, benefits, and working conditions, notably the lack of paid sick time and low wages for contractors.
- The union previously conducted a one-day strike over management's response to workplace issues.
- The strike authorization underscores increasing tensions between union members and management regarding employee treatment.

items.title: The FAA hiding private jet details might not stop celebrity jet trackers
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- The FAA is implementing a process to protect private jet owners' registration details, potentially complicating the work of celebrity jet trackers like Jack Sweeney.
- Sweeney argues that determining aircraft ownership requires research and connections with media rather than solely relying on the FAA’s database.
- The FAA's plan stems from the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2024, responding to privacy concerns about jet tracking that affected social media platforms.

items.title: A shady, shuttered tech bootcamp may be sneaking back online
items.author: Lauren Feiner
items.summary:
- The CFPB shut down Prehired, a tech sales bootcamp, for deceptive loans burdening students.
- FastTrack is allegedly the new guise under which Prehired may be operating, offering similar terms.
- Prehired was ordered to refund $4.2 million and void $27 million in loans, but has reportedly done little to comply.
- Consumer advocates express concern that FastTrack is replicating Prehired's deceptive practices.
- The weakened CFPB may struggle to enforce regulations against FastTrack amid internal and political challenges.

items.title: Google’s Pixel 10 Pro Fold might be mostly a spec bump
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- The Pixel 10 Pro Fold appears similar to its predecessor, suggesting it may be largely a spec bump.
- Renders show the same camera layout as the Pixel 9 Pro Fold with a hole-punch camera on both displays.
- Dimensions are nearly identical to the Pixel 9 Pro Fold: 6.1 x 5.9 x 0.21 inches.
- Likely features an upgraded Tensor G5 processor and potentially a lower starting price than $1,799.
- Minor improvement noted with a smaller gap between the screen and device's hinge on the left side.

items.title: The best Xbox controller to buy right now
items.author: Quentyn Kennemer
items.summary:
- The Xbox Wireless Controller is the best option for most Xbox or PC gamers due to its balance of quality, comfort, and price.
- Alternatives to consider include options from brands like 8BitDo, PowerA, Razer, Scuf, and Turtle Beach.
- The standard Xbox controller is reasonably priced at around $60 and features great connectivity options including Bluetooth.
- The 8BitDo Ultimate Wired Controller serves as a budget-friendly alternative at about $28, known for its lightweight design and satisfying buttons.
- The Xbox Elite Wireless Controller Series 2 offers extensive customization options but comes with a high price tag of around $150 and some reported quality control issues.

items.title: The Sonos Arc is down to a new all-time low price
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- The Sonos Arc soundbar is now available for $599, which is $300 off its original price.
- Features include eight woofers, three tweeters, upward-firing Dolby Atmos speakers, and eARC support.
- Can function as both a soundbar and a smart speaker, compatible with Google Assistant, Amazon Alexa, and Apple’s AirPlay 2.
- The Sonos Arc Ultra was released as a more powerful version, priced at $999, offering Bluetooth audio and Trueplay EQ tuning.

items.title: Searching for the perfect minimalist smartphone
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary:
- Discussion on the concept of a minimalist smartphone that offers essential features while avoiding distractions.
- Highlights the new Light Phone III and its capabilities.
- Covers the recent Tesla Takedown protests and the demands of the protestors.
- Explores upcoming tariffs affecting the auto industry and new developments in electric vehicles.
- Answers a question about in-home cameras that can locate misplaced items.

items.title: Dbrand’s new skins let you ‘touch grass’ without the hassle of going outside
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Dbrand has launched the Touch Grass collection, allowing users to wrap devices in artificial turf.
- Available for over 100 devices, pricing is $29.95 for smartphones, $49.95 for tablets, and $69.95 for laptops.
- The skins use electrostatic flocking to secure thousands of polyethylene strands, ensuring durability and preventing shedding.
- Traditional cutting methods were replaced with laser cutting to prevent edges from loosening.
- Touch Grass skins serve as unintentional lint catchers but are easy to clean.
- The product raises concerns about contributing to microplastics pollution upon disposal.

items.title: Substack says it’ll legally defend writers ‘targeted by the government’
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Substack partners with the nonprofit FIRE to protect foreign writers in the US from government targeting.
- The initiative responds to a recent arrest of a Tufts University student allegedly linked to her criticism of US foreign policy.
- Substack's Defender program has previously offered legal assistance to writers and is expanding its support to those facing government actions.

items.title: Spider-Man: Beyond the Spider-Verse swings into theaters in 2027
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- Sony officially announced the new release date for *Spider-Man: Beyond the Spider-Verse* on June 4th, 2027.
- This announcement was made at CinemaCon, along with a trailer screening and new images featuring main characters Miles Morales and Gwen Stacy.
- Originally planned to release in March 2024, the movie's premiere was delayed due to production challenges, including reports of overworked animators and the impact of the 2023 SAG-AFTRA strike.
- The film's co-directors and producer emphasized that these delays were beneficial for the project's quality.
